Item.Item: Toshiba Excite 10 AT305-T16 16 GB - Champagne silver
Toshiba Excite 10 AT305-T16 16 GB - Champagne silver
Item.Review:
Pros: WiFi; Operating System; Easy to navigate; Battery Life; Fast performance; Web Browsing; Screen
Cons: Screen resolution
I wasn't a huge fan of tablets at first but since I work in the tech field I decided to give the excite a try. I'm glad to say I'm impressed. Toshiba did a nice job of engineering such a useful piece of technology. From downloading to web browsing to just playing games it does it well and then some. If you have a busy lifestyle this tablet is just for you. Thin and sleek it's easily portable but yet the screen is just the right size for doing just about anything. Micro USB and HDMI, SD card slot for expandable memory, it already has more options than most tablets on the market. My only con is that Toshiba needs to fix the screen resolution. It falls wel ... l short in comparison to the ipad2. At a [$] price tag I expected. A better quality display. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Toshiba Excite 10 AT305-T16 16 GB - Champagne silver
Item.ReviewTitle: Good but pricier than the competition
Item.Review:
Pros: 4+1core CPU/Nvidia GPU, DDR3 memory, thin and light, Android 4.0(ICS), SD card slot, microUSB&HDMI, good wifi/GPS recptn
Cons: Price (but as low as 399 in other places), bulky charger/cable/connector, camera sucks
This tablet would have been a better(competitive) value if priced the same as the Acer A510 or Asus TF300. Screen has light bleed but only noticeable when looking at dark images in the dark. Otherwise, it's a good screen with very good color, contrast, sharpness, brightness when compared to the WXGA (1280x800# competition. Watching HD #especially 720p# videos at normal viewing distances, I don't think that I'll miss the upcoming 1920x1200 screens. This tablet is very thin #I believe that only the TransPrime and the Excite LE are thinner#. It is also ... very light #for a 10-inch tablet# at only 1.3lbs. Battery life is 7 to 8 hours of very heavy usage. Good enough to last a day or two of normal usage. Storage is expandable via full size SD card slot #add up to 128GB#. Unfortunately, the cameras #front and back# are not very good. They're probably okay for casual use #and only in good lighting conditions.# The microUSB and microHDMI ports are nice additions should the need for them arise. The Tegra3 CPU is fast. Live Wallpapers do not make the home screens transitions jerky anymore even with multiple active widgets. No doubt that the DDR3 RAM helps too. Too bad it's not dual channel. Wifi and bluetooth range is good. So is the GPS reception. But I wish that Toshiba included support for 802.11a #5ghz) wifi to help avoid interference in high wifi density environment. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Toshiba Excite 10 AT305-T16 16 GB - Champagne silver
Item.Review:
Pros: Fast Hardware, Responsive touchscreen and software.
Cons: Cheap Construction materials. Terrible LCD construction.
Here's my Story.
After going through a Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 10.1 which had a Great Screen, and audio for a tablet, but laggy and prone to stuttering with the TI Omap Processor. Returned because of Performance issues and frustrating hangs in apps and web pages.
Then the Asus Tf300 with a Very fast Tegra 3, Poor screen colors and really flimsy plastic back. Returned because it had debris under the screen and some kind of oily residue.
Then the Asus tf700 Infinity with its gorgeous 1920x1200 Super IPS+ panel with great color, an all metal back. Returned this due to one entire line of dead pixels from top Bezel to Bottom Bezel about 3 in ... ches from the left side of the tablet.
The Excite 10 was My last shot at an Android tablet since I don't like any of the Acer line. It's light. It's thin. It creaks like a Pirate ship when you apply even minor pressure to any of the edges. the inlay back-plate wiggles around when you apply pressure. The screen distorts if you hold it one handed due to the Construction materials not being stiff enough to support the tablet weight with one hand. I could Ignore these, if the tablet had a good screen. In the loosest terms, the screen is good. It is good on color saturation. Contrast is good. Black levels leave something to be desired after using my Super AMOLED Galaxy note all day at work. White levels are blindingly bright. But... It has Terrible, Huge Light bleeds around all edges of the screen, Specifically the top is worst. I had triangular shaped Light blooms that extend about an inch out into the screen about 1/2"-1" from each other across the top, three of them. It looks like someone is shining a pen light at the edge of the screen constantly. Do any web search for Excite 10 Screen quality. All the reviews I have read say All tablets have this problem to some degree, excluding Acer who seems to not have it, but has color issues instead, Toshiba is the front runner for light bleed problems. ALL tech reviews cite this Light bleed is ... expand » « collapse

I like it because is thin,soft.easy to use,faster.loock nice, for work and have fun. it has one app like the samsung note has,(s pen ).Good sound quality,Responsive touch screen,

Item.Item: Toshiba Excite 10 AT305-T16 16 GB - Champagne silver
Item.Review:

Cons: None
Use it for mostly websurfing and games. It is a great item.

Item.Item: Toshiba Excite 10 AT305-T16 16 GB - Champagne silver
Item.Review: It's thin, which is great. It has a full size SD card slot. I use it to view playback from my Panasonic GH2 camera on a 10 screen. I tried this on a Tegra 2 device, and it wouldn't play. The Tegra 3 in this one, though, plays it just fine. You might have to find the right software for the file type that your camera records in. Mine records to AVCHD and I use Dice Video Player. Unfortunately, Toshiba didn't include the drivers for third party file managers to be able to access the SD card slot, -1 star. And it doesn't look like there will be enough of a following for this tablet for the modders and hackers to come up with a custom ROM, so this probably won't ever be an option. The speakers are really good. The tablet I bought before this one and returned had terrible speakers. This one ... has two speakers at the bottom, and with the volume all the way up, it's quite loud. There is a little light bleed into the screen, which is really only noticeable when the screen is black or a darker color. I noticed it the first couple of days, and haven't noticed it at all since. It hasn't changed, it just doesn't bother me enough to notice it. It's also a good option if you need a portable teleprompter setup, but don't want an iPad because you're already set on Android. If you want a thin tablet and you're a photographer or videographer who uses SD cards (or probably other card types with an OTG cable and a card reader), this is the tablet for you. Plus HDMI if you do a lot of presentations. For other people, I would still recommend this tablet based off the sound, speed, thinness, and screen. But if you don't need all of the I/O options, you might consider other tablets that have more of a following. But for me, this was the only option on the market, and I'm very happy with it. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Toshiba Excite 10 AT305-T16 16 GB - Champagne silver
Item.Review: Great hardware performance except there are a lot of light bleeding at the edge of the screen. Also the battery life does not even come close to what is advertised. I would recommend if AND ONLY IF it's upgradeable to Android 4.1 (Jelly Bean).

Item.Item: Toshiba Excite 10 AT305-T16 16 GB - Champagne silver
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to Use; Efficient; Easy To Set Up; Quality Construction; Reliable
My husband loves his tablet! He is not computer literate AT ALL and yet, he does great with this! I would highly recommend it to anyone! It is not 3G or 4G, but automatically picks up wifi anywhere we go. Free internet is all over the place!

Item.Item: Toshiba Excite 10 AT305-T16 16 GB - Champagne silver
Item.Review:

Cons: the battery
This is my first tablet and have owned it for almost 2 months. I absolutely love it. Very easy and quick to set up and use.

Item.Item: Toshiba Excite 10 AT305-T16 16 GB - Champagne silver
Item.Review:
Pros: Fast, very good sound quality, good battery life
Cons: A little of backlight bleeding
Fantastic tablet. The quad core can play full HD videos with no problem. The sound is pretty amazing as well. Loud enough to view movies without using headphones.
I was concerned at first with some reviews about the backlight bleeding problem, but it´s not a big deal. In fact, I can only notice the light bleeding while I turn on the tablet. It´s is impossible to notice seeing photos or watching movies.

Item.Item: Toshiba Excite 10 AT305-T16 16 GB - Champagne silver
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to Use; Efficient; Easy To Set Up; Reliable; Quality Construction
This is my first mobile device and I'm glad I didn't buy an iPad. I already had a Gmail account, so setup was easy. Everything is integrated. I'm pleased with the purchase.

Item.Item: Toshiba Excite 10 AT305-T16 16 GB - Champagne silver
Item.Review:
Pros: fast, easy to set up
Had one tablet for a week and noticed a bright spot on the screen, took it back and exchanged it, 2nd one had no problems. Battery life is not up to par with an old Xoom tablet I had previously.

Item.Item: Toshiba Excite 10 AT305-T16 16 GB - Champagne silver
Item.Review:
Pros: Battery Life; Easy To Customize; Screen; Operating System; Web Browsing; WiFi; App Availablity
I use the Exite mostly for entertainment along with reading all my e-mails. The sound quality is better when downloading an EQ app. The full size SD card reader is great for watching AVI movies. Again there are some better apps out there to read the AVI movie files. Overall very satisfied. Make sure you get one of the new Toshiba form fitting cases to protect your new tablet as well.

Item.Item: Toshiba Excite 10 AT305-T16 16 GB - Champagne silver
Item.Review:
Pros: Android 4.0, size and weight over Thrive, SD memory card slot, usb connector
Cons: display a little washed out, battery can drain quickly
I was looking for an Android tablet that had good ways for making connections for data transfers, etc. This is one of the few with an SD card slot and a USB port. Don't have to go through the hassle of setting up wifi or BT connections. This also had a quad processor which gives a feeling of not getting outdated quickly. Have liked ICS much better than earlier versions. Most apps work smoothly and quicker than before. Feels sturdy and easy to hold. Would also have wished they put the charger connector in another location. In landscape mode it is on the bottom of the screen. The real problem is that the connector is rather large so it' ... s difficult to recommend another location without causing the same issue.
I don't see the light bleed that has been mentioned but may not be using it in the same way. The display has good color but the resolution could have been better. Can quickly drain the battery in standby mode with programs such as Tweetcaster running. That may be more of an app problem than a tablet problem but can be disconcerting turning it on mid day and having only 30% power after leaving it on standby overnight. Haven't searched the device for a way to control this, there might be one built in.
Overall I am happy with the tablet and recommend it to anyone but especially to someone doing a lot of data transfers. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Toshiba Excite 10 AT305-T16 16 GB - Champagne silver
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use, fast, slim and light
Cons: Display good, but not great
Love the tablet. Well made quality design. Used as often as my laptop. The display seems a little washed out during regular use, but looks excellent when playing video.

Item.Item: Toshiba Excite 10 AT305-T16 16 GB - Champagne silver
Item.Review:
Pros: Speed, Screen
Cons: Power Button, Battery Life
This tablet is the best Android tablet I've seen. The speed is excellent and the screen is as well.
The battery life lasts for hours, but I haven't found a way to have it shut down after being suspended, so leaving it suspended overnight tends to drain the battery completely.
The power button is a little quirky, as it requires holding it in for several seconds. If the battery is exhausted, it does not turn on for a few minutes, and not easy to tell its charging.
The issues aren't major and certainly not a reason to bypass this tablet.

Item.Item: Toshiba Excite 10 AT305-T16 16 GB - Champagne silver
Item.Review:
Pros: Web Browsing; Battery Life; Screen; Easy To Customize; Operating System; WiFi; App Availablity
I absolutely love this tablet. It is simple to use and I much prefer it to my laptop. The only down fall I have come across is I have to use word for school and I haven't been able to use it for anything that has to do with word. It's probably just something I have to take the time to figure out.

Item.Item: Toshiba Excite 10 AT305-T16 16 GB - Champagne silver
Item.Review:
Pros: Android 4.0, Battery life, Screen resolution
Cons: Price point, availability of accessories
This review is written by a first-time tablet owner and long-time Android fan. While I first questioned the price ($449), the ability to utilize 18-month financing from Best Buy made this tablet a no-brainer. I know Toshiba does not have the best track record with tablets but I can say I am satisfied with my purchase.
Being the owner of an Android phone (Gingerbread 2.3) and two Google TV devices (Honeycomb 3.0) the ease in starting up and syncing the device was spectacular. Within about 20 minutes all of my apps were installed and ready to use.
Due to the item being new accessories were not available through Best Buy but I was able to get a stylus, portfolio cover ... and neoprene cover from the Toshiba website for less than $80 delivered.
The price point is tough to comprehend given the 16GB capacity, but I feel as though the full-size SD Card slot more than makes up for it. In addition, the microUSB and microHDMI add more than most tablets. I see this device settling in around $374.99 but for the time being I think it should be priced at $399 (Although the 18-month financing option is no longer available). At less than $27/month, this tablet is a no-brainer. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Toshiba Excite 10 AT305-T16 16 GB - Champagne silver
Item.ReviewTitle: Great Android tablet, better features than iPad
Item.Review:
Pros: ICS 4.0, very light, very fast Quad core processor,full size SD slot, gorilla glass
Cons: Current lack of accessories
This is a great Android tablet ! Toshiba has improved alot from their Thrive, and Excite LE. Right out of the box, the battery is charged and ready to go. Set up is easy. ICS 4.0 is nice. The quad core processor is fast, and I haven't had any lag time with video play. Gorilla glass protects the impressive screen. The Excite 10 is very light, well built, and easy to hold and handle. I love that it has a full size SD slot for expansion. Comes with great preloaded apps, without alot of the ones that you would never use anyway. Considered a little pricey, but WELL WORTH IT !

I have owned many tablets over the years and this Toshiba is $80 less than a Ipad and gives you a lot more for your money i.e. HDMI out, full size SD card slot and micro USB port all built into the tablet with no need for add-on's.

First off, I did return this item and got the Asus Infinity instead. The performance was off consistently in running more than 2 apps at a time. The HDMI could not be adjusted and was very dark on the output regardless of what TV or monitor used. I would not recommend this item.

I was planning to get the new Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 10.1, but doing my research I found the Toshiba Excite 10.1 was using the Tegra quad-core is significantly faster. The case is more durable than the Galaxy Tab 2, and I wanted a USB port, which would have been an add-on option to the Galaxy. Both the Galaxy 2 and the IPad seem to have a better screen resolution but it is insignificant, and there is a small bleed of light on the top of screen only during power-up which does not appear during normal usage. The internet signal and GPS signal strength are extremely strong on this device. I was amazed where I can be in home basement and get stron ... g GPS satellite usage. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Toshiba Excite 10 AT305-T16 16 GB - Champagne silver
Item.ReviewTitle: Nice tablet, but some light bleed
Item.Review:
Pros: Fast, built well and full SD slot
Cons: Light bleed
I had the Acer A510, but a few things bugged me: Runs very hot on right side, vertical lines due to LCD design and USB located on bottom (not practical- should have been on side).
The Toshiba misses the issues noted above and is faster than the A510. The SD slot is very nice and I am currently using a 128GB SDXC card. Works great!
The negative is light bleed. I notice it when viewing darker scenes and is similar to the Asus Prime in this regard. Some tablets are worse than others for the bleed, based on trying a couple out. The demo unit at BB had hardly any light bleed (ironic). Touch response is GREAT.

Item.Item: Toshiba Excite 10 AT305-T16 16 GB - Champagne silver
Item.Review:

The Toshiba Excite 10 sets a new design standard for thin and light 10-inch tablets, but the specs don't live up to the name.

Item.Item: Toshiba Excite 10 AT305-T16 16 GB - Champagne silver
Item.ReviewTitle: High quality parts, poor quality control
Item.Review:
Pros: Mechanics; parts: processor, speed, screen, responsivness
Cons: Scuff marks under top screen layer; on 3 different tablets
So I was "excite"d to find out that at least 1 of the Best Buys in my area had just received a shipment in. I ordered it online (to pick up in store) at around 5am, just to make sure I could have a copy reserved (didn't know if there would be a line outside for these things so I wanted to be on the safe side). I showed up at 10am to pick it up (at Denver West, Lakewood Store 382).
Once I got to my car I immediately opened it up and turned it on. During the load up process, I was checking out the screen and physical attributes of the tablet. Shockingly I observed what appeared to be wet dog nose scuff marks underneath the top screen layer (the ... re's the lcd screen glass, then a thin layer of presumably gorilla glass about 1mm above the lcd screen). I figured I just might have smeared some finger prints on the screen, and being overly cautious and prepared, wiped them off with my Monster screen cleaner. Now I got mad b/c I was right, the marks were underneath the top layer and could not be removed.
(Now onto my return into Best Buy) I went back to cust/ser and spoke with "Dani". Under regular light, you're not able to see the marks unless the screen is on. So when she said she couldn't see the marks, I used my led light from my phone and showed her. She gave me the typical, "Well Ill have to take it to a Geek Squad Agent so they can look at it" bit. So I said okay; they got procedures they got to go through (I used to work at store 186). She came back about a minute later and said, "Well, GS said they could clean them off and the reason why there were marks on it was b/c you didn't buy a screen protector." (My blood boiled inside, 1 b/c now they think I'm just an incompetent customer who doesn't know what he's talking about, and 2 b/c they placed the blame on me for what they thought I scuffed it up and also in not buying a screen protector which didn't even exist at their store at the time of purchase)
So...staying calm, but visibly angry, I told Dani she had to be ... expand » « collapse
